title: NCSW announces training opportunity on “Gender and Child Rights” for journalists
content:
ISLAMABAD, Sep 12 (APP):The National Commission on the Status of Women (NCSW), in collaboration with UNICEF Pakistan, has announced an exciting training opportunity on “Gender and Child rights” for journalists across Pakistan.
According to the NCSW, the Media Fellows with a minimum of seven years of experience are invited to participate in specialized training focusing on gender and child rights.
This initiative aims to foster a more responsible and informed media narrative surrounding these important social issues.
Journalists interested in applying can submit their applications via the provided link.
The deadline for applications is set for September 20, 2024.
Participants will have the chance to enhance their skills and contribute to a media landscape that prioritizes inclusivity, gender parity, and empowerment.
The training program is a significant step towards promoting responsible journalism and fostering a greater understanding of gender and child rights within the media.
The training will be held at Islamabad, Quetta, Peshawar and Lahore during November 2024 to February 2025.
